overall_description: A classic half-eternity style ring featuring a polished 18k yellow gold band set with seven round brilliant-cut green emeralds. The setting utilizes a shared-prong gallery structure with an open-work under-gallery to maximize light entry.

image_generation_prompt.main_prompt: A single isolated 18k yellow gold ring mount setting, devoid of gemstones. The object is a circular ring shank that thickens at the top to form a bridge containing seven adjacent circular seats for stones. Vertical gold prongs rise between each seat, currently standing straight up in an un-set position. The side profile reveals a scalloped under-gallery with U-shaped openings allowing light through the side. The metal is highly reflective, smooth, and polished yellow gold. The bottom of the shank is a simple tapered D-profile band.
image_generation_prompt.style_modifiers: Product photography, macro lens, sharp focus, 3/4 perspective view, neutral gray background, 8k resolution, photorealistic manufacturing rendering
image_generation_prompt.negative_prompt: gemstones, diamonds, emeralds, green color, scratches, blurred, noise, fabric background, fingers, hand
image_generation_prompt.lighting_description: Soft studio lighting with high contrast reflections to highlight the metallic curvature and prong details

components.shape_description: Torus-like base transitioning into a linear array of circular baskets with vertical protrusions (prongs)
components.manufacturing_notes: Produced via lost-wax casting. The model must account for shrinkage factors. Prongs must be cast longer than finished height to allow for bending over the stones.

image_generation_prompt.main_prompt: A single isolated round brilliant-cut emerald gemstone. The object is a precise geometric cone shape consisting of a flat top table, faceted crown, thin girdle, and faceted pavilion converging to a culet point. The material is a translucent, vibrant deep green crystal with internal light refraction and vitreous luster. The geometry is perfectly symmetrical with sharp, defined facet edges.
image_generation_prompt.style_modifiers: Macro gemology photography, ray-traced rendering, caustic lighting effects, clean white background, high fidelity
image_generation_prompt.negative_prompt: metal, ring, setting, inclusions, cracks, dust, gold, silver, multiple stones
image_generation_prompt.camera_angle: Side profile showing depth of the cut (pavilion and crown)
image_generation_prompt.lighting_description: Backlit to show translucency, front spotlight to create specular highlights on facets

components.material_suggestion: Natural Emerald or Hydrothermal Synthetic Emerald
components.position: Set within the 7 seats of the Ring Mount
components.manufacturing_notes: Requires 7 identical units. Stones must be calibrated to match the seat diameter of the mount (approx 3.0mm - 3.5mm).

additional_notes: For 3D reconstruction, the ring is best generated as two separate assets (the metal mount and the stone) and then assembled. Generating them together often fuses the geometry, making it unsuitable for manufacturing analysis.
